actor_awards.notes: Best known for his role as Paul Varjak in 'Breakfast at Tiffany's' and as Col. John 'Hannibal' Smith in the 1980s television series 'The A-Team'. He won the National Board of Review Award for Best Supporting Actor for 'Home from the Hill'.

filmography.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
filmography.role_description: A struggling writer and 'kept man' who becomes the neighbor and romantic interest of Holly Golightly.
filmography.plot: A young New York socialite becomes interested in a young man who has moved into her apartment building, but her past threatens to get in the way.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: A rugged frontiersman, soldier, and eventual marshal who spans several decades of American expansion.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

filmography.title: The Blue Max
filmography.role_description: An ambitious and ruthless German fighter pilot in WWI who seeks the coveted Blue Max medal at any cost.
filmography.plot: A young German soldier strives to become a flying ace in World War I, but his lower-class background and obsession with the Blue Max medal alienate him from his fellow aristocrat pilots.

filmography.title: Home from the Hill
filmography.role_description: The illegitimate son of a wealthy Texan landowner who becomes a mentor to his legitimate half-brother.
filmography.plot: The story of the conflicts within a wealthy Texas family, centering on the relationship between a strict father, his wife, and their two sons.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Carpetbaggers
filmography.role_description: A ruthless industrialist and film mogul loosely based on Howard Hughes, who builds an empire while alienating everyone around him.
filmography.plot: A young playboy inherits his father's aviation company and expands it into a movie studio, becoming a powerful but lonely tycoon.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Operation Crossbow
filmography.role_description: An American officer and engineer who goes undercover to infiltrate a Nazi rocket facility.
filmography.plot: Allied commandos are sent on a mission to destroy a Nazi missile plant during World War II.

filmography.title: Pork Chop Hill
filmography.role_description: A soldier fighting in the Korean War in this gritty and realistic war drama.
filmography.plot: While peace negotiations are going on, a US Army company must attempt to recapture a hill from the Chinese.

filmography.title: The Strange One
filmography.role_description: A cadet at a Southern military academy who stands up against a sadistic upperclassman. Peppard's film debut.
filmography.plot: A manipulative cadet at a military academy exerts a sinister control over his fellow students until a newcomer challenges his authority.

filmography.title: Battle Beyond the Stars
filmography.role_description: A whiskey-drinking space trucker from Earth who joins a group of mercenaries to defend a peaceful planet.
filmography.plot: A young farmer sets out to recruit mercenaries to defend his peaceful planet from an evil tyrant.

filmography.title: Damnation Alley
filmography.role_description: A military officer leading a group of survivors across a post-apocalyptic America in a specialized vehicle.
filmography.plot: In a post-apocalyptic world, a group of survivors travel across the desolate landscape in an armored vehicle to reach a safe haven in Albany, New York.

filmography.title: The Victors
filmography.role_description: An American soldier whose experiences are followed throughout World War II and the immediate aftermath.
filmography.plot: A look at the lives of a group of American soldiers during World War II, from the Blitz to the occupation of Berlin.

filmography.title: The Subterraneans
filmography.role_description: A writer who explores the beatnik subculture of San Francisco and falls for a neurotic French girl.
filmography.plot: A writer falls in love with a French existentialist in the beatnik culture of San Francisco.

filmography.title: House of Cards
filmography.role_description: An American boxer-turned-expatriate in Paris who gets caught up in a political conspiracy.
filmography.plot: An American adventure-seeker in France is hired as a tutor but becomes a pawn in a fascist plot to take over the country.

filmography.title: Rough Night in Jericho
filmography.role_description: A former lawman and gambler who stands up to a corrupt town boss.
filmography.plot: A former Marshal and a former outlaw team up to save a town's stagecoach line from a ruthless businessman.

filmography.title: What's So Bad About Feeling Good?
filmography.role_description: A beatnik living in New York who catches a virus that makes him inexplicably happy.
filmography.plot: A virus carried by a toucan spreads happiness throughout New York City, much to the dismay of the cynical establishment.

filmography.title: P.J.
filmography.role_description: A down-on-his-luck private investigator hired to protect the mistress of a wealthy tycoon.
filmography.plot: A private eye is hired to protect the mistress of a millionaire but finds himself framed for murder.

filmography.title: Pendulum
filmography.role_description: A police captain who becomes a suspect in the murder of his wife and her lover.
filmography.plot: A police captain notorious for securing convictions finds himself accused of murder and must rely on the legal system he has often criticized.

filmography.title: The Executioner
filmography.role_description: A British intelligence agent who hunts down the traitor responsible for the death of his colleagues.
filmography.plot: An intelligence agent suspects a colleague of being a double agent and sets out to prove his guilt.

filmography.title: Cannon for Cordoba
filmography.role_description: An Army captain assigned to retrieve cannons stolen by a Mexican revolutionary.
filmography.plot: A U.S. Army Captain leads a team into Mexico to destroy cannons stolen by a rebel leader.

filmography.title: One More Train to Rob
filmography.role_description: A train robber released from prison who seeks revenge on the partner who betrayed him.
filmography.plot: A train robber gets out of prison and goes after the partner who double-crossed him.

filmography.title: The Groundstar Conspiracy
filmography.role_description: A ruthless government security chief investigating sabotage at a secret space research center.
filmography.plot: A security agent uses brutal methods to uncover a saboteur within a secret space project.

filmography.title: Newman's Law
filmography.role_description: A tough, honest cop who is framed for corruption and must clear his name.
filmography.plot: A wrongfully accused police officer goes rogue to uncover a drug ring involving corrupt cops.

filmography.title: Five Days from Home
filmography.role_description: An ex-cop convicted of manslaughter who escapes prison to see his dying son. Peppard also directed this film.
filmography.plot: A man escapes from a Louisiana prison to reach his critically ill son in California before it's too late.

filmography.title: The Third Day
filmography.role_description: A man suffering from amnesia who must piece together his life and discover if he committed a crime.
filmography.plot: An amnesiac man tries to reconstruct his past while facing accusations of murder.

filmography.title: Race for the Yankee Zephyr
filmography.role_description: A smooth-talking villain searching for a gold-laden plane wreck in New Zealand.
filmography.plot: A man and his daughter team up with a pilot to find a WWII plane wreck loaded with gold, while being pursued by criminals.

filmography.title: The Tigress
filmography.role_description: An oil magnate and con man in 1920s Berlin. Peppard's final film role.
filmography.plot: A con artist couple in Berlin targets a wealthy oil tycoon, but the plan goes awry.
